intro: Kyllinga honolulu, commonly known as the Hawaiian arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes that bloom in late spring or early summer. Kyllinga honolulu typically grows in wet, marshy areas or along the edges of ponds and streams. It is an important part of the local ecosystem and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats.
